page.title: 19Sculpture
page.content: {Sculptors}have been working in Grizedale Forest since 1977. The Sculptures are made mostly of wood but also of other materials such as metal and rock. The subjects are mostly animals and figures, but there are some abstract shapes too. These are the names some of the sculptures; Heron, Boar, Scale Green Bird Man, Deer Hunter, Private Meeting, Crows, Midnight Feast, Waiting For Lunch, Cliff Sculpture, Ting, The Seven Spires, Woodland Winders. Most people like the Private Meeting, the Scale Green Bird Man is also popular. The sculptors come from all over the country and stay in the forest chalets when they are making the sculptures. They are supported by a grant from Northern Arts. My favourite sculpture is the spider Waiting For Lunch.
